feedback.name: We crashin' again sir? - choose equation.

item.name: label
item.presentation:
The spaceship, “Serenity”, going down, has just done a “Crazy Ivan” to flip end-for-end.  So, it is going down, but it is accelerating straight up.  Help Zoe answer her question by choosing the correct  knowns/unknowns for this situation.

Using axes located at the ground, with y-axis pointing up, we concluded that the following is a correct way to write the knowns and unknowns.

\( y_i \) = 1000 m, \( y_f \) = ?, \( v_{iy} \) = -300 m/s, \( v_{fy} \) = 0, \( a_y \) = 70 m/s\(^2\)

Choose the equation that would let you solve for \(y_f\) in one step.

item.label: answer
item.presentation: r>>>>>\( v_{fy} = v_{iy} + a_y \Delta t\) |\( y_f = y_i + v_{iy} \Delta t + \frac{1}{2} a_y \Delta t^2\) |\( {v_{fy}}^2 = {v_{iy}}^2 + 2 a_y (y_f - y_i)\)
